intro: Amsinckia congruens, commonly known as the stickyhead sunflower, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, sticky leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Amsinckia congruens is often found in coastal and inland areas, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
